metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26710 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in iOS 15.5 and iPadOS 15.5, macOS Monterey 12.4, tvOS 15.5, watchOS 8.6. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26710` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.36.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.36.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.36.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.36.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.36.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.36.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.36.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.36.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.36.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.36.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.36.4-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
wpewebkit package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
